topic.title: Hello dwellers of ZeroNet
topic.body: I hope you day is going well. I would like to know what Zites you think I should seed now. I am getting a drive bay enclosure in the mail Sunday. It will house a 500GB hard drive that ZeroNet can use most or all of its space. Right now I have a dedicated server (repurposed hp laptop, will run ZeroNet 24/7) that uses very little power that I tinker with as a hobby. I remote into it when I want to use ZeroNet. I am all about free speech and the spread of democracy, ZeroTalk seems to be a great Zite for that. Could you all perhaps give me a few links for those whom want to start seeding useful or helpful Zites? (Unfortunately image board Zites are a no-go due to the cp)

topic.title: Trouble reaching Zite
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Board.ZeroNetwork.bit/

I can't get it off the connecting page, is something wrong? There are many peers connected so I assume people are on it now.

topic.title: Is the IFS website still active?
topic.body:
I'm rather new to ZeroNet and I've been poking around for a few months now. IFS
http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/
seems to be a great file hosting solution without you needing to be directed to a onion site. Its really convenient as you get to pick and choose the content you seed as you view the contents of the file. While it is a moderated site (only blocking CP) it seems to be a great Zite for public file distribution. I am piecing together the history of ZeroNet and it is becoming my main form of leisure activity versus clear net activities. What caused it to not flourish?

topic.title: Is this a working youtube alternative on ZeroNet?
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/18Pfr2oswXvD352BbJvo59gZ3GbdbipSzh/?Home

Here it is, bask in its beauty. Its fast and it has a great easy to use UI. This is what I was looking for in terms of a decentralized video and media sharing site. It seeds videos you watch and doesn't to those you click on. There is a convenient seeding category to free up space and there is [NSFW] tags on videos title. It feels like YouTube in terms of UI.

I only wish there was a setting to delete videos you don't watch starting from the oldest one in the list automatically with a set storage amount (I don't mind giving up 80GB for the cause).

Right now the content is flowing at a slow but steady rate. Try it out, mostly there are memes and some [NSFW] content. I could see this taking off.

topic.title: Possible security breach (user caused) with revealing ZeroNet to local network
topic.body:
So I watched this video:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1508167290_16t83GyRixTRFbTL91Lvk2q3Z8kJzJfAXH

(On KopyKate BIG OFFICIAL)
(Its a video about giving your external IP an address and assigning a ZeroNet server a port on port 80)
I did not want to make ZeroNet public on my network so I only changed my config.
-----------
[global]
optional_limit = 120
tor = always
fileserver_port = 25144

ui_ip = *
ui_port = -------
-----------
(Dashed lines to hide my selected port)
My ui_port is NOT 80 and my server does NOT have the selected port forwarded externally and my server is behind a router (Requiring a port to be opened externally, out of the two ports I have open ui_port is NOT one of them). However, upon starting ZeroNet there was a dialog that said your ZeroNet UI is open to the internet! The reason I would do this in the first place is to reveal the UI to my trusted home network. For the first five seconds I tested it it worked great (The same ZeroNet instance can be opened on my phone/PC/tablet) before I killed it and rolled back the config. I am fairly confident that the ZeroNet UI and services are not open to the internet but I wanted to check with y'all. I am adept to web servers, perhaps in a future ZeroNet update there will be a UI toggle for noobs like me?

topic.title: Android browser for ZeroNet.
topic.body: What browser do you use/suggest for ZeroNet on Android? I can't change proxy settings for the latest tor browser (Android) so what are good alternatives?

topic.title: KopyKate can't seed own content
topic.body:
http://192.168.1.44:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Home
(KopyKate site)
I have put up a video but it says 0/0 peers. Is that inclusive or exclusive? There is a option to seed with the +seed button available but clicking it does nothing. Is it working?

http://192.168.1.44:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1575000339_1BL1pFELvZ58apCLcxogy2W66aC4vKLfY3
(SFW news capture about trump)

If it does work, I have a server running with a dedicated hard drive. What should I put on KopyKate? news articles? movies? The entire site of you tube before COPPA wipes out all channels?

topic.title: Kopy Kate upload feature seems not to work
topic.body: I uploaded 2 videos on big.kopykate.bit and I wanted to check if my videos where going through. I tried to download and seed these videos but I could not get the video to play. My server has hosted this video for over a week and on recently. BOTH ZeroNet instances are over tor. Peers are stuck on 0/0 for both and I don't have the ability to watch the videos when I navigate to them in the browser. I have not checked Kopy Kate's files for the video I have hosted, ill update when I check. The computer I am trying to watch the video on has a fresh instance of ZeroNet running. Perhaps I don't have enough trackers yet?

topic.title: AI DUNGEON 2
topic.body: It came out yesterday and does any one have it? I cant download it because they cant serve the files so would you mind sharing on Zero Up?

topic.title: The entire Wikipedia, the free (in beer LOL) encyclopedia
topic.body:
I am downloading XOWA and a whole 65 GB wiki database. Ill dump a copy on my Zeronet server. There, you can download and or seed the entire database and application. I cannot believe I have found this just now. What a human accomplishment honestly. The download was unstable for me so I thought I would put it here so it can be more stable.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/12MVkvYGcRW6u2NYbpfwVad1oQeyG4s9Er/index.html?view:item+id:15f7_1KruxJQQfajktbt58UXVm2THe3tjjL7t98_item_8+type:archive

1573231068_14g2gXnsZdEPShFJkGdh5W3eGXmKz.body: I have a laptop always running (plastic, keyboard and screen removed leaving nothing but the motherboard). I then remote into it when I want to browse ZeroNet. Soon I will have a hard drive attached to house all of ZeroNet's data and Zites

1573159148_11553Fm1cV9cYruFuVX5eLkXUMthj.body: Because it needs to download all Zites to seed them when ZeroNet starts, Its always ready.

1573278709_1BL1pFELvZ58apCLcxogy2W66aC4v.body:
> [filips](#comment_289_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): You can set up New ZeroNet Sites script (but be careful of sites with illegal content with this way as script automatically downloads sites). [...]

Alright, I am seeding you Zites now! Thank you for your suggestions!

> [xcape2net](#comment_546_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): I would appreciate it if you would seed ZeroTalk Tech:  1EfLnw7GDXbZfJmGNoXGQ4XkuHGWkRZTMq [...]

ZeroTalk Tech along with the others are being seeded now. Thank you for your cool Zites!

Ill need to wait until I prefect a secure system on my network before I randomly start downloading and seeding new Zites automatically. I like the idea and in a perfect world I would jump on seeding random Zites without my consent or visual approval however, a few love to abuse absolute freedom. Id like ZeroNet to be friendly enough for others to adopt without fear of getting in trouble for just using a service. Someone should split up 08Chan so each board has their own Zite (/g/ would be a good example of a community that would become a role model for how to self moderate.) The board /g/ would be great to seed but it seems it has turned into ZeroTalk Tech?

> [filips](#comment_292_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): There is plan to make decentralized Reddit alternative with all (most) features from the real reddit (decentralized subreddits, management...). See this for more details.

I checked the Reddit alt idea and it's kinda what I was looking for. I'm really excited for it to go from idea to execution!

You haven't happen to be a class C personnel did you?

1573303435_1MGP7Q7y11YBjwi2dUkB2Q93Kusgx.body: Look, I don't want you to die. You bring up a good point I agree with though "Its only logical". I once did think that but there is a reason for everything. If you don't believe in God then you can easily make the argument that "everything is pointless" however, Only a fool would believe there is no higher force beyond your sight that has purposely created you. Why anything? Time has and always been scripted and, there is a start and there is an end, events will be played out in the meantime. Even though things are bad wouldn't you so desperately seek the end you are supposed to see? Why would an organism purposely curtail its existence? There might be nothing else to do or see but that's NEVER true. I'm on the edge of my seat exhausting myself to ensure my future so I can get a job that can support a family of my own. And if I can't? Ending it all should not be in your cards. If you've given up TIME is your only God now so why would you reject your gift given directly to you and no other? Please, I don't know who you are but the God that one of us believe in seek to help you. If you are hesitant on taking your life, time has been steering you away. Listen to it.

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_124_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): ....and the most peaceful way to make the heart stop is?.....drum roll please......

Why do you seek destruction? What do you get out of it if you've never seen this person before?

> [anonymouslogin](#comment_126_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): The world already has too many people. Why encourage anyone to stay and consume precious resources if they want to leave? Irrespective of your faith in higher power or lack thereof, if you want to check out, check out. Don't procreate, as likely a mental illness is informing your choices regarding survival and you're offspring may inherit it. Inert gas flooding is an effective way to kill numbers of organisms silently and painlessly in their sleep, or their prison cells..... ;-)

We all are an extension of each other. Unfortunately, you are only hurting yourself trying to undo harm that you have unfortunately. While I cannot confront you, I hope someone does by opening the door for you or complementing you. We all share the same dirt and those who feel like they don't try to alienate others and devise dirt. I encourage our friend here to stay because our acts will echo throughout the future. You argue traits are passed down through us right? And a solution is to self terminate right? What is left? You. Do not weaponize said resources to shed others of theirs. That use them in vein wouldn't it? Re-arranging the pieces sounds like a constructive idea. Kaar, Moving to a new town with a resume sounds like near reincarnation. You can make a new set of friends and routines.

> [kaar4bears](#comment_58_1MGP7Q7y11YBjwi2dUkB2Q93KusgxDCqsr): climate apocalypse? facebook-google regime? governments spying on our very thoughts? muslims invading europe? you call that 'better'?

climate apocalypse? Two things will happen not in our lifetime, Humans learn to be efficient or how to survive on another planet. facebook-google regime?? I just upset my peers by telling them about google ripping up peoples accounts, they all agree its wrong. I suggested to setup thunderbird or hotmail accounts and backing up photos locally to steer away from the cloud. Governments spying on our thoughts? Close but its big companies that use that as a source of income. Again, If the centralized internet was perfect we wouldn't be on this platform evading all of thus said. Things snap back like a spring, When we say "It will get better" we are serious. Its the conservation of energy really, nothing is permanent.

> [kaar4bears](#comment_72_1MGP7Q7y11YBjwi2dUkB2Q93KusgxDCqsr): Smog is so bad where i live that weather guys recommend not going outside unless really needed (I guess they don't realize people MUST go to work every day?). Scientists think it will drastically reduce our lifespan and it damages children physical development. I don't wanna live in such world. [...]

I live in a quite diverse area. Going through school devoured with "diversity" wasn't so bad, I just saw others that drug down average GPA as leverage and it made me shine. It worked but, about the smog in your area. I'm sorry you live in that climate. Perhaps you should scrape together what you have and move? I don't know if that's in your cards but its worth thinking about it and maybe looking forward to? Some areas in the U.S are covered in 100 Y.O trees with absolutely stunning landscape and if you live far enough away from cities it becomes a quiet paradise. For google and Facebook, one of my hobbies is trading stock in massive companies and the overthrowing of some is in motion. Intel has been "King for too long" and AMD is swooping in. Too many security breaches start to jar at others consciousness and making them switch. Its starting to reflect in the Stock market. Perhaps the same will happen to google and Facebook. I'm exited for that.

1573845173_1MqNGUHk63CGdv7KMZ9br6NvCUcDC.body: Here is my unpopular opinion, the people. Hear me out, each branch might have its own interests but the imperfect system is made by imperfect people. While it can be argued to be inefficient, I am very glad decisions are not made with haste. In the end, they are just trying their best (50/50) to utilize tax money. Maybe its because I live in a good community where we talk to officers like they are our friends and they do the same. I had a talk with the firemen and they gave me a tour of how the fire truck works, it was really cool and they where glad to show me around. Our neighborhood also paid for an American flag grill that looks really cool on the truck too. They worked themselves hard when Harvey hit our area too setting up camp in our local grocery store. I guess its a small town thing so you get my small town answer. How about you Sully?

> [kaar4bears](#comment_68_1MGP7Q7y11YBjwi2dUkB2Q93KusgxDCqsr): Best utilize tax money? Maybe best for THEM. In my country, politicians live like kings because they steal most of MY tax money. We taxpayers however, are in majority very poor with shit jobs.

I did say 50/50, using probably around %50 for actual work and the rest for anything OTHER than that.

I'm not going to disclose any names but, your right xcape2net. Someone I know hasn't gotten any reports for a week strait. He is almost bored to tears too, and yes most of the time he just waits for reports and kills time in the process. He is trying to get another job as innovation is not encouraged in the work place. There are some hard working people in there though but, the just a few levels up they are following STRICT protocol from the highest. Inefficient because its in standby most of the time but if disaster strikes its a organized machine ready to pounce or, at least I hope so. Higher up is where most energy is waited in the food chain though for any type of system.

1574217448_1BL1pFELvZ58apCLcxogy2W66aC4v.body:
> [mg0](#comment_167_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): ui_ip =  allows all addresses to connect to the server, only limitation is knowing the port which is fairly easy to be done with nmap or a tiny script using netcat. what you need is to only allow your home network to access your server, I think maybe zeronet allows you to use something like 192.168.0. being your home network under 192.168.0.0/24 network but I'd personally recommend setting up a firewall too.

Anyone externally can use the computer hosting ZeroNet even though the port is not exposed to my public IP? How could someone on the outside preform a port scan internally if (1. My services don't respond to ping 2. My two ports forwarded are do NOT match the port Ive set up on my home network. I see how those two ports can be seen.)? Do you mean if someone is on my home network? If that's the case, sure, id expect that.

> [mg0](#comment_168_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): Yeah, I meant for anyone inside your home network, sorry for not being clear with that.

If that's the case, I should be fine. ZeroNet running locally cant check if its port is exposed to the external network without getting a external computer to check. The UI prompt is great though, It could catch someone else that is running their computer directly out of the modem and let them know about their config.

> [mg0](#comment_169_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): I don't think that prompt really checks much before saying your PC is exposed to the internet, I think it just checks if any address besides local address (like 127.0.0.1 and ::1) are being allowed and triggers that message, so it will say that even if you only accept connections originated from your PC's local network address instead of localhost for example.

Sounds about right. I used to browse through a screen sharing software, this is MUCH better.

> [styromaniac](#comment_1294_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): It would be simple to test. I've port forwarded to my phone and temporarily had file servers online. After that, you'd navigate to your public IP and the port number. Going online like that is very intentional and not accidental, so I think you're fine.

If I knew your phones ip and preformed a port scan to reveal a FTP server running and you had no password I could scrape everything. Same here, I thought about it. I'm fine but what you did is potentially dangerous.

> [styromaniac](#comment_1298_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I understand the risk. Most of the time it was limited to a selected folder.

Ok, but in my case I can't have such risk.

> [ratsmack](#comment_102_16BaY5JLzzA8TPe4jzXtp3CfZi3Qks2SU5): That's kinda the way Freenet works. If content isn't accessed for a period of time, it will cease to exist on the network. That prevents stale crap from accumulating and eating up disk space.

1575342587_17bfQv5PQW9FZ4akChr7ECfqP2SKu.body: That would be a great idea if Zeronets contents where well seeded and huge. I don't run a data center so if people don't seed in Zeronets infancy it could steer people away. It would be nice if it was temporarily stored and downloads and seeds by default.

> [duck0](#comment_153_17bfQv5PQW9FZ4akChr7ECfqP2SKuAXwM5): I run on a laptop, and need to see about running it on my phone.  [...]

I got an old laptop from a friend for $20. It only draws like 6W from my wall. Try to go to thrift stores and poke around for a used laptop. Once you have one watch this video to set up Zeronet for your local network ONLY. (I use this as my always on seedbox/zeronet server. I can then go to any of my devices and browse.)

http://192.168.1.44:43110/big.kopykate.bit/?Video=1508167290_16t83GyRixTRFbTL91Lvk2q3Z8kJzJfAXH

And then you should be set up. Alternatively, if you have an android phone to burn (Local store has them for around $20 with microSD expansion.) set it up on that. I'm afraid you cant set it up for your whole network though.
